original_text:
**INSTITUTION
NEUROSURGERY
TRANSFER SUMMARY
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
TRANSFERRED DATE :
**DATE[Sep 17 07]
TRANSFERRED TO :
SOUTHMORELAND
TRANSFERRED TO CARE OF :
DISPOSITION :
Southmoreland .
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS :
SHUNT MALFUNCTION .
POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS :
SHUNT MALFUNCTION .
PROCEDURE :
THE PATIENT HAD REMOVAL OF VP SHUNT .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
This **AGE[in 80s]-year-old male nursing home resident was admitted over the weekend due to some nausea and emesis .
He had several episodes of emesis .
He had coughing for several days prior , sometimes coughing up food .
He had a mild neurological change over the last few days , primarily somnolence and fatigue .
Past Medical History -
1) NPH with shunt placement on **DATE[Jul 28 2008] .
2) Coronary artery disease status post stent in **DATE[Jan] of 2001 .
3) He has diabetes mellitus Type 2 .
4) Hyperlipidemia .
5) Arthritis .
6) Diabetic neuropathy .
7) BPH .
8) He had a CVA in **DATE[Oct] of 2005 .
9) Loss of vision in his left eye in **DATE[Oct] of 2006 .
Surgical History :
1) Left knee replacement in 1995 and right knee replacement in 1994 .
The patient had laboratories which were essentially all normal .
He had a CT of the head which was pretty unremarkable except for some small vessel disease .
No acute process .
The patient had a shunt series which was pretty unremarkable .
The patient 's chest x-ray showed minimal atelectasis .
The patient was started on antibiotic for presumed aspiration pneumonia .
The patient was taken to the OR for an exploration of the right shunt and revision of the shunt .
The patient had a CSF culture and gram stains which were basically unremarkable .
He had surgery on **DATE[Sep 16 2007] .
The patient was taken to recovery room , did well .
He was sent directly to a regular floor .
Sutures in place on the right side of his skull .
No arrhythmia , unusual swelling or discharge .
The abdominal incision course is well healed without any sign or symptom of infection .
So it is deemed he can be transferred back to Southmoreland , his current residence .
He will be brought back next week and set up for the OR on Tuesday , **DATE[Sep 23] .
He will have a left-sided VP shunt placed .
If there are any questions or concerns , call **PHONE .
TRANSFER INSTRUCTIONS :
1) The patient is to have one time creatinine level drawn since he had a CT of the abdomen and pelvis with contrast here .
He is also on some medications .
He ( 6.08 ) could present kidney issues .
2) The patient is to be seen by PT and OT for assessment and treatment .
3) He is on DVT prophylaxis .
4) He is on a low scale sliding insulin , regular 12 unit .
5) He is on an 1800 kilocalorie ADA diet .
TRANSFER MEDICATIONS :
His medications are as follows :
1) Avandia 4 mg p.o. q. 24 hours .
2) Metformin 500 mg p.o. q. 8 hours .
3) Simvastatin 20 mg p.o. q. h.s. ( bedtime ) .
4) Saw **PLACE 400 mg p.o. q. 24 hours .
5) Metoprolol 12.5 mg p.o. q. 12 hours .
6) Isosorbide CR 30 mg p.o. q. 24 hours .
7) Gabapentin 300 mg p.o. q. 8 hours .
8) Donepezil 10 mg p.o. q.h.s. ( bedtime ) .
9) Vitamin B6 50 mg q. 24 hours .
10) Vitamin B12 500 mg q. 24 hours .
11) Solifenacin 5 mg p.o. q. 24 hours .
12) Xalatan ophthalmologic solution one drop left eye at bedtime .
13) Timolol ophthalmologic solution one drop left eye q. 12 hours .
14) Alfuzosin 10 mg p.o. q. 24 hours .
15) Unasyn 1.5 grams IV q. 6 hours .
16) Heparin 5000 units subcu q. 8 hours .
17) Low dose 12 unit insulin scale .
The patient is to have the VP shunt revision on **DATE[Sep 23 2007] .
Hold his Plavix and aspirin until after his surgery on **DATE[Sep 23 2007] .
Keep the OR site , the right side of his skull dry until the sutures are removed .
If there are any questions , call **PHONE .
___________________________________
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[VVV XXX , WWW-M]
RL/pap
D : **DATE[Sep 17 2007] 07:28:16
T : **DATE[Sep 17 2007] 07:37:14
R : **DATE[Sep 17 2007] 07:37:14/pap
Job ID :
